title: How to Import Emails to Gmail: Your Ultimate Guide

steps.title: Make sure your old email account has POP access.
steps.content: Make sure your old email account has POP access. You can normally find this option in your other account's “Settings.” In this method, you will import both old and new messages from your old account to your Gmail account on an ongoing basis. If your old email provider doesn't support POP, you can use our importing old mail instructions to import old messages only. [1] X Research source If the account you want to import email from is not a Gmail account, jump down to the next step . If the account you want to import mail from is also a Gmail account, you will need to enable POP access in your settings. Here's how: In the account you're importing mail from , click the gear icon at the top-right corner of your inbox and select See all settings . Click the Forwarding and POP/IMAP tab at the top. Under "POP Download," select "Enable POP for all mail." If, in addition to importing these messages to your new Gmail account, you also want to keep a copy in this account, select keep Gmail's copy in the inbox from the menu. If not, you can choose to delete Gmail's copy . Click Save Changes at the bottom.

steps.title: Click the gear icon .
steps.content: Click the gear icon . If your old account has POP enabled, you can now adjust the settings in your new Gmail account to import the messages. It's at the top-right corner of your inbox. This opens the Quick Settings menu. Complete these steps on the Gmail account where you're importing messages to .

steps.title: Click See all settings.
steps.content: Click See all settings . It's near the top of the Quick Settings menu.

steps.title: Click the Accounts and import tab.
steps.content: Click the Accounts and import tab. You’ll see this at the top of the settings box.

steps.title: Click Add a mail account.
steps.content: Click Add a mail account . You'll see this next to “Check mail from other accounts”.

steps.title: Enter the email address you're importing from and click Next.
steps.content: Enter the email address you're importing from and click Next . This should be the email address for the messages you're importing to this new account.

steps.title: Choose to use Gmailify or POP3.
steps.content: Choose to use Gmailify or POP3. Gmailify will also allow you to send email as your old address as well as your current Gmail address. If you choose POP3, you will only import the emails.

steps.title: Sign in to your old email account if prompted.
steps.content: Sign in to your old email account if prompted. Enter your password to continue.

steps.title: Check the boxes for "Always use a secure connection (SSL) when retrieving mail” and “Label incoming messages.”
steps.content: Check the boxes for "Always use a secure connection (SSL) when retrieving mail” and “Label incoming messages.” Don't check other boxes.

steps.title: Click Add Account.
steps.content: Click Add Account . Importing all your emails or linking your email account can take a while, depending on how many messages you'll be importing. When they finally import or link, you should see all the mail in your Inbox. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the gear icon .
steps.content: Click the gear icon . You'll see it at the top-right corner of your Gmail inbox. Use this method if you're switching to this new Gmail account and only want to import the existing messages from your old account. This will not continuously import emails to your Gmail account on an ongoing basis.

steps.title: Click See all settings.
steps.content: Click See all settings . It's near the top of the Quick Settings menu.

steps.title: Click the Accounts and import tab.
steps.content: Click the Accounts and import tab. You’ll see this at the top of the settings box.

steps.title: Click Import mail and contacts.
steps.content: Click Import mail and contacts . You’ll see this in the “Import mail and contacts” header.

steps.title: Enter your old email address and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter your old email address and click Continue .

steps.title: Sign in to your old email account.
steps.content: Sign in to your old email account. You’ll need to accept/allow the export of emails from this account by pressing Continue in the pop-up.

steps.title: Click Start Import.
steps.content: Click Start Import . This may take a few minutes, but you’ll eventually find all your old emails in your Gmail account. [3] X Research source New mail sent to that old account will also be forwarded to your Gmail for 30 days.
